titleStmt.title: Cambridge, Massachusetts, Harvard Law School, MS 49.

msItem.title: Calendar; readings from the Gospels; Magna carta with statutes; register of writs

history.provenance: Provenance: obits of Richard de Orford (d. 1310), bishop of Ely, and for members of the Sewall family (1335–1400), John Totel (d. 1462), John Totehill (d. 1507), Otis Abrycotehill (d. 1521); olim MS 227, Jean Baptiste-Joseph Barrois (d. 1855); sold to Bertram, 4th earl of Ashburnham in 1849; sold to George Dunn, Sotheby’s lot 556, 10 June 1901.

listBibl.bibl: Bibliography: HMC, 8th Report, p. 80; Barrois Collection, p. 204; De Ricci, p. 1032, no. 49; ELMUSA, pp. 25–6.

body.p:
Cambridge, Massachusetts, Harvard Law School
MS 49. Calendar; readings from the Gospels; Magna carta with statutes; register of writs. 90 ff. 170 x 105 mm.
Provenance: obits of Richard de Orford (d. 1310), bishop of Ely, and for members of the Sewall family (1335–1400), John Totel (d. 1462), John Totehill (d. 1507), Otis Abrycotehill (d. 1521); olim MS 227, Jean Baptiste-Joseph Barrois (d. 1855); sold to Bertram, 4th earl of Ashburnham in 1849; sold to George Dunn, Sotheby’s lot 556, 10 June 1901.
Bibliography: HMC, 8th Report, p. 80; Barrois Collection, p. 204; De Ricci, p. 1032, no. 49; ELMUSA, pp. 25–6.
